sentence.text: ï»¿A 5 years old Egyptian male patient, presented to the Limb Malformations and Skeletal Dysplasia Clinic (LMSDC) at the National Research Centre (NRC) with skeletal deformities, intellectual disability, delayed speech, and autistic behavior.
He was born to consanguineous parents and there were no other similarly affected family members (Pedigree Fig. 1A).
There was a prenatal history of doubtful maternal gestational diabetes and oligohydramnios in the last trimester.
Delivery was unremarkable, and the birth weight was 4.5 Kgm (+1.89 SD).

On physical examination the patient had trigonocephaly and dysmorphic features in the form of low anterior hairline, hairy forehead, synophrys, dense arched eyebrows, hypertelorism, squint, and long philtrum.
Orodental evaluation showed everted lower lip, microdontia with spacing of teeth, macroglossia, high arched palate and long uvula.
Both hands showed bilateral clinodactyly of 5th fingers and camptodactyly of 3rd, 4th and 5th fingers.

Genu varum was noted more on the left side in addition to bilateral talipes, right bifid broad hallux, left preaxial accessory knob like big toe, 2nd and 3rd toes partial soft tissue syndactyly, 4th and 5th toes syndactyly and hallux valgus (polysyndactyly) (Fig. 1, B-H).
There was history of hypoplastic scrotum and bilateral undescended testes and orchidopexy was successfully performed on the left side.
Anthropometric measurements showed tall stature 125.4 cm (+3.61 SD), marked obesity with weight 42.3 Kgm (+11.0 SD) and his head circumference was 53.6 cm (+1.5 SD).
Abdominal ultrasound, brain CT, fundus examination and hearing test were normal.

Electroencephalogram (EEG) revealed mild focal left fronto-temporal epileptogenic discharge and brain MRI revealed atrophic changes in the form of dilated ventricle, deep sylvian fissure, and small retro-cerebellar cyst.

Due to the patient's intellectual disability and absence of speech, Adaptive Behaviour Assessment (ABAS-3) was applied to evaluate 10 adaptive areas organized in three main domains (conceptual, social, and practical).
Results showed that the adaptive skills were below average in all evaluated fields.

According to the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fifth Edition (DSM-V) and the administration of the Childhood Autism Rating Scale (CARS), the patient has moderate autism spectrum disorder (ASD).
Basal growth hormone, growth hormone with stimulation, thyroid profile and insulin levels were normal.
Chromosomal studies by conventional G-banded karyotype showed a normal male karyotype (46, XY).
